songs.lyrics:
Hand over hand
I’m pulling myself together
On this itchy couch again
I’d pull you in
But
I couldn’t help thinking
Or
My mouth was tarpaulin

Let me start again:
I didn’t mean to say so
Much about my plans
So you see my hand
See? It’s never either/or now
Stigmata ampersand

The morning is the self it’s self evident
A clattering of blinds
A mimetic wind
A sympathetic tremor I’m
A tessela of signs

O I close my eyes and
Fractal inner rings of varicose resign
Coiled dark inside
I’ll open my eyes and clear my
Throat when I know it’s time

description.plain:
In a 2016 Pitchfork interview, Evan was asked about the best advice he’d ever received.

I took a James Joyce seminar and my professor said: “When reading Joyce, it’s never either/or. It’s always and.” And that advice extends to just interpreting experience. It’s an adventurous perspective, and it also does not try to collapse or reduce or one-dimensionalize experience—there are many layers to everything that’s going on, and they’re not competing, they co-exist. And you don’t have to choose. In fact, to choose is a little bit foolhardy. Never either/or, always and… [points to his “&” tattoo].

raw.embed_content: Read “&” by Pinegrove on Genius

And you don’t have to choose. In fact, to choose is a little bit foolhardy. Never either/or, always and… [points to his “&” tattoo].

songs.title: Amulets
songs.lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Little amulets
Along the window
I got this feeling
Like I'll always love you
But I know that feeling
How it moves through
Ooh, and through me
And it's changing already

[Verse 2]
Then on the ambulance
And out the window
Sequence of colors
Blue and red and then blue

songs.title: Angelina
songs.lyrics:
Washing windows with Angelina
I don't understand anything
Violent angles from side to side
How'd you get so tangled up in my life?
How'd you get so caught?
How'd you get so tangled up?

I love you like it's the old days
When I could ask you anything
How'd you get so tangled up in my thinking?
How'd you get so caught?
How'd you get so tangled up?

description.plain:
Evan wrote about “Angelina” in his reddit AMA in March 2016.

it’s basically 3 different melodies over the same chords, in different vocal registers. i try to play with the tension of it by selectively introducing symmetrical melodies on different layers of the song. it all feels familiar because basically it’s just variations on the same thing. i use the same trick in aphasia

songs.title: Alexander All Alone
songs.lyrics:
[Verse 1: Andy Shauf]
Alexander all alone
Smoking a cigarette
The last pack he’d ever buy
At least that’s what he said
He stood up to stretch his back
And fell down to the ground

[Verse 2: Andy Shauf]
Alexander all alone
'Till the neighbour caught a glimpse
Cried out for his wife
To call the ambulance
Alexander all alone
Felt them check his pulse
He heard them pronounce him dead

[Chorus]
Hell is found inside of me
And nothing else will set me free
If hell is found inside of me
Then open me up and spill me out

[Verse 3: Andy Shauf]
Alexander wondered why
No life flashed before his eyes
Why his soul did not depart
Why he found no peace of mind
Would it take a little while?
Was it the same for everyone?
Alexander realized

[Chorus 2]
That hell is found inside of me
And nothing else will set me free
If hell is found inside of me
Then open me up and spill me out

description.plain:
This song tells the story of Alexander, who is at the party.
As he is alone (maybe outside) smoking a cigarrete, he falls (or jumps) and falls…in the next verse we discover he is hurt and the ambulance comes.
Alexander is pronounced dead, but he can’t find enlightenment, no light, no memory flashes.
He is trully all alone.

songs.title: All the Same
songs.album: Love and the Memories of It
songs.lyrics:
The greenest grass you'll ever see
Lies silent on the earth
Where I could never be
And the brightest sun that's ever shined
As you walk away
It dances there behind, or so I find
But it's all the same anyway

I'll hold you in the setting sun
Would that be boring
Would it be any fun for you
Maybe I could fix your pain
But what is life if it's always sunny
If there's never any rain
If it's all the same anyway, then it's all the same anyway

You are the mittens to my coldest hands
The purest rain to the driest lands
A brand new friend on a lonely day
Most beautiful girl I'd have to say
Please be mine on this very night
Hands are shaking, knees not quite
It's all the same anyway, well maybe it was but not today

Stay with me this little while because all I know is you make me smile

Would that be boring
Would it be any fun for you
Maybe I could fix your pain
But what is life if it's always sunny
If there's never any rain
If it's all the same anyway, then it's all the same anyway

You are the mittens to my coldest hands
The purest rain to the driest lands
A brand new friend on a lonely day
Most beautiful girl I'd have to say
Please be mine on this very night
Hands are shaking, knees not quite
It's all the same anyway, well maybe it was but not today

Stay with me this little while because all I know is you make me smile

songs.title: Angela
songs.lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Angela, you need to write home
Send your mother a letter
Tell her that you're okay
'Cos i don't need the company
She's calling me like every single day

[Verse 2]
Angela, when you come home
Could you bring me back a carton of cigarettes?
When are you back anyway?
Everyone misses seeing your face

[Verse 3]
Angela, thanks for the postcard
Sounds like France is everything you dreamed
I know that we're not serious
But i wish that it could be the two of us

[Verse 4]
Angela, Jen let it out
That you had met some guy in Paris
Well let me know, 'cos that's okay
Really you don;t need to say a thing

[Outro]
Angela, please come home
And tell us all your stories from far away
Angela, please come home
And tell us all your stories from far away
I bet that you would love to know
Everything that's happened here

description.plain:
Unreleased from Shauf. Possibly one of the songs cut from the Bearer of Bad News record, as he had written over 100 songs for the album yet narrowed it down to just 11.

I found this in a streamingcafe.net stream from september 2014. I can only assume the title of the song is “Angela”. Lyrics are all added by ear, but im pretty confident I’ve got them down.

This song is about a guy reaching out to his love interest who has moved away to Paris, France. He’s begging for a response back from her and wishes she would come home so that they can be together.

raw.embed_content: Read “Angela” by Andy Shauf on Genius
